answers.answer: "Could i have diabetes"To answer your question, yes. First off, there is no such thing as a "blood machine." It's apparent you used your husbands home blood glucose meter to obtain the 3.9, 3.9, 4.7 readings, which I'm assuming was in mmol/l. It makes a difference if these figures were preprandial or postprandial. At 3.9 mmol/l lethargy starts to set in. If this was 2-4 hours after a meal (postprandial) you have very dangerous low levels. In any case you need to see a doctor asap to get tested for diabetes.

question: Hi i do not have diabetes as far as l am aware , but l used my husbands blood machine and my leveles have been 3.9  3.9 4.7. I have a cold right now would this affect my levels .Looking back though i do get tired a lot and irritable and sometimes pass urine a lot . I go to the gym three times a wek and do eat heathy .  I dont eat chocoalte or biscuits .Could i have diabetes
title: Not diabetic
